Title: How to prove that $ \sum_{n \in \mathbb{N} } | \frac{\sin( n)}{n} | $ diverges?
Content: It is stated as a problem in Spivak's Calculus and I can't wrap my head around it.
AcceptedAnswer:
Hint: $|\sin n|\geqslant \sin^2 n$, and use the convergence of $\sum_{n=1}^{+\infty}\frac{\cos(\color{red}2n)}n$ and the divergence of harmonic series. We have $\cos(2n)=2\cos^2n-1$, and 
$$\sin^2n=1-\cos^2n=1-\frac{\cos(2n)+1}2=\frac{1-\cos(2n)}2.$$
